member.name: T:Outpost31.Core.Configuration.RuntimeSettings
member.summary: Runtime setting logic for the Tingen Web Service.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Configuration.RuntimeSettings.TngnSystemCode
member.summary: The Tingen Web Service System Code.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Configuration.RuntimeSettings.RequiredDirectories
member.summary: Directories required by the Tingen Web Service.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Configuration.RuntimeSettings.RequiredFiles
member.summary: Files required by the Tingen Web Service.

remarks.para:
The Tingen Web Service requires the following files to be present in the ./AppData/Runtime directory:
tngn.build The Tingen Web Service build information.
tngn.mode The Tingen Web Service mode.
tngn.systemcode The Avatar System Code that the Tingen Web Service will interface with.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Configuration.RuntimeSettings.RequiredFolders
member.summary: Folders required by the Tingen Web Service.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Configuration.RuntimeSettings.ValidSystemCodes
member.summary: The list of valid System Codes.

remarks.para:
The Tingen Web Service will only interface with the following Avatar System Codes:
LIVE The Avatar production environment
UAT The Avatar testing environment

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Configuration.RuntimeSettings.ValidTngnModes
member.summary: The list of valid Tingen Web Service modes.

remarks.para:
The Tingen Web Service can have one of the following modes:
DISABLED The Tingen Web Service does not do any work.
ENABLED The Tingen Web Service functions normally.
PASSTHROUGH The Tingen Web Service writes log files, but does not make any modifications to data.

members.member: Load the runtime settings for the Tingen Web Service. The Tingen Web Service version Runtime settings for the Tingen Web Service. ///

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Configuration.RuntimeSettings.AreValid(Outpost31.Core.Configuration.RuntimeSettings)
member.summary: Verify the Tingen Web Service settings.

remarks.para:
All of the RuntimeSettings must be valid before the Tingen Web Service can start.
The Tingen Web Service mode
The Avatar System Code
The Tingen Web Service build

member.summary: Returns the contents or status of a file.
member.returns: The content or status of the file.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Utilities.Du.DuFile.ReturnVerifiedContent(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Returns the contents (if valid) or status of a file.
member.returns: The verified content or status of the file.

member.name: T:Outpost31.WelcomeToOutpost31
member.summary: A place for Outpost31 details and stuff.

remarks.para:
Outpost31 is the back-end logic for the Tingen web service.
This class is just a placeholder for documentation, and where the Outpost31 version number is
updated (see the header above).
While you're here, take a look at this stuff:
The Tingen Documentation
Uh...I guess that's it. Thanks for stopping by!
